Authors:
Gustavo Angel Bich, Maria Lorena Castrillo, Laura Lidia
Villalba, Pedro Dario Zapata
Title:
Mycoparasitic Trichoderma koningiopsis against Leucoagaricus
gongylophorus as a potential biocontrol agent of leaf cutting ants
Keywords:
Trichoderma koningiopsis; Leucoagaricus gongylophorus;
Biocontrol agent; Leaf cutting ants
Abstract:
Trichoderma koningiopsis isolated from a leaf cutting ants
nest was tested against three Leucoagaricus gongylophorus strains from
leaf cutting ants by dual culture technique under laboratory conditions.
Based on ITS sequence data, molecular analysis showed three
well-separated main clades in which the isolated Trichoderma strain was
found to assemble as a sole subclade among T. koningiopsis strains.
Additionally, the result showed that this T. koningiopsis strain inhibit
growth of all L. gongylophorus tested. The percentage of inhibition of
radial growth values of L. gongylophorus were ranging from 58% to 69%
and the average mean value of T. koningiopsis against all L.
gongylophorus strains was 65%. In dual plate tests Trichoderma
koningiopsis proved to be an effective biocontrol agent against three
Leucoagaricus gongylophorus strains from nest of leaf cutting ants.
